content:
Kyoto is a food lover's paradise! You've made an excellent decision to stay in Kyoto for 7 nights, as it will give you ample time to explore the city's culinary delights. Here are some must-try food spots in Kyoto:

**Traditional Kyoto Cuisine:**

1. **Gion Nanba** (): A renowned restaurant serving traditional Kyoto-style kaiseki (multi-course) meals. Try their seasonal courses, which feature local ingredients. ( Approx. ¥20,000 - ¥30,000 per person)
2. **Kyubey Gion** (): A Kyoto institution for high-quality, traditional Kyoto-style sushi. Opt for the omakase (chef's selection) course. (Approx. ¥20,000 - ¥30,000 per person)

**Ramen and Noodles:**

1. **Ichiran Ramen** (): A popular, no-frills ramen chain with a unique, rich tonkotsu (pork bone) broth. (Approx. ¥890 per bowl)
2. **Tofuya Ukai** (): For a unique experience, try their tofu-based ramen or other tofu dishes. (Approx. ¥1,000 - ¥2,000 per person)

**Street Food and Snacks:**

1. **Nishiki Market** (): A narrow shopping street lined with over 100 food stalls and shops selling fresh seafood, fruits, and local specialties like miso, pickles, and Japanese sweets. (Free to browse, food prices vary)
2. **Yatsuhashi**: A traditional Japanese sweet shop offering freshly made, crispy yatsuhashi (a type of cookie) and other local sweets. (Approx. ¥500 - ¥1,000 per person)

**Cafes and Desserts:**

1. **% Arabica** (): A popular, high-end coffee shop with multiple locations in Kyoto. Try their signature iced coffee. (Approx. ¥500 - ¥1,000 per person)
2. **Gion Tokuya** (): A historic tea house serving traditional Japanese sweets and matcha-based desserts. (Approx. ¥500 - ¥1,000 per person)

**Other Recommendations:**

1. **Kyoto-style Yudofu** (): Try this boiled tofu dish at various restaurants throughout the city, often served with dipping sauces. (Approx. ¥1,000 - ¥2,000 per person)
2. **Kushikatsu** (): A popular izakaya (Japanese gastropub) dish, where skewers of meat and vegetables are deep-fried. (Approx. ¥500 - ¥1,000 per person)

Remember to also try some of the local seasonal specialties, such as kaiseki, shojin-ryori (Buddhist vegetarian cuisine), and yudofu during your stay.

Your hotel booking on Booking.com looks like a great deal! With 7 nights in Kyoto, you'll have plenty of time to explore the city's culinary scene and discover even more hidden gems.

Enjoy your trip to Kyoto!
